text.value: During your pregnancy for your youngest child, did you receive any information about taking iron-folic acid tablets?
During your pregnancy for your youngest child, did you receive and/or purchase iron-folic acid tablets?
Why did you not receive or purchase iron-folic acid tablets?
During your pregnancy for your youngest child, did you take iron-folic acid tablets?
Why did you not take iron-folic acid tablets?
During the whole duration of your pregnancy for your youngest child, how many days did you take the iron-folic acid tablets?
Is in any programme that treats acute malnutrition?
Have you heard about MNP or seen MNP [show sample/photo of MNP]?
Have you received or bought MNP (show sample/photo of MNP) for ?
Why did you not receive/buy MNP (show sample/photo of MNP) for ?
Did you give the MNP (show sample/photo of MNP) to eat?
Why did you not give the MNP (show sample/photo of MNP) to to eat?
In the last week, how many times did eat MNP (show sample/photo of MNP)?
In the past 6 months, has received drops from a capsule like this one (show vitamin A sample or photo)?
Why did not receive (show vitamin A capsule sample or photo)?
What type of capsule (show sample or photo of blue and red capsule) did get drops from?
How many months ago did receive drops from (show vitamin A sample or photo)?
Took too long to get tablets
I was told not to take it
Took too long to get MNP
Not seen other mothers use it
Took too long to get drops
Child not able to be examined
Mother / carer went to the health centre but the child was not measured
Mother / carer cannot carry more than one child
Mother / carer feels ashamed or shy about coming
There is no one else to take care of the other siblings
The child has been rejected by the programme already
Other parent's children have been rejected
Thought it was necessary to be enrolled at the hospital first
Does not think the programme can help child/children (prefer traditional healer, other treatment)
Heard that children who took treatment/ration/products got diarrhoea
Lack of money to pay for transport
Condition improved and discharged by the programme
Discharged because child was not recovering

bind.jr:constraintMsg: Enumerator ID must be between 1 and 6
Child's age must be between 6-59 months
MUAC must be between 5.0 and 20.0 cms, or 0 if child cannot be measured
Weight must be between 2 and 54, or 0 if child cannot be weighed
Height must be between 30 and 155, or 0 if child cannot be measured
Child's age must be between 6-59 months
MUAC must be between 5.0 and 20.0 cms, or 0 if child cannot be measured
Weight must be between 2 and 54, or 0 if child cannot be weighed
Height must be between 30 and 155, or 0 if child cannot be measured
Child's age must be between 6-59 months
MUAC must be between 5.0 and 20.0 cms, or 0 if child cannot be measured
Weight must be between 2 and 54, or 0 if child cannot be weighed
Height must be between 30 and 155, or 0 if child cannot be measured

bind.calculate: "Refer child to most appropriate treatment centre"

select1.label: Survey area
District
Enumeration Area
Survey team ID

input.label: We are from the Liberian Institute of Statistics and Geo-Information Sevices (LISGIS). We are conducting a survey of children aged 6-59 months old and their mothers. We will be measuring the child's body and then we will be asking you about you and your child's access to different health and nutrition services. The survey will take about 15 minutes. The information that you will provide will help the Ministry of Health of Liberia in improving mother and child health and nutrition services.

select1.label: Are you willing to participate in this survey?

input.label: How many children aged 6-59 months does this mother have?

select1.label: Is the mother present to be interviewed?

input.label:
If the mother is not present to be interviewed, continue with measuring her child/children and asking caregiver/relative about the other questions relevant to the child. Then arrange to come back within the day (if time allows and mother will come back soon) to interview mother.
Do not mark this form as finalised to allow editing until you get to interview mother. If not possible to come back to interview mother or if mother not coming back within the day, finalise questionnaire.

select1.label: During your pregnancy for your youngest child, did you see anyone for antenatal care?

select.hint: Tick all that apply. Do not prompt. Probe "Any other reasons?"

item.label: Took too long to get tablets

select.hint: Tick all that apply. Do not prompt. Probe "Any other reasons?"

item.label: I was told not to take it

select1.label: During your pregnancy for your youngest child, did you receive any information or heard about any service that provided counselling for pregnant women on infant and young child feeding?
During your pregnancy for your youngest child, did you attend any counselling session/s for pregnant women on infant and young child feeding?

select.label: Why did you not attend the counselling sessions?
select.hint: Tick all that apply. Do not prompt. Probe "Any other reasons?"

input.label: How many counselling sessions did you attend?

group.label: Anthropometric data for all children 6-59 years old in household

select1.label: Gender of child
Does have a health card?
Do you know 's exact date of birth?
select1.hint: Since 's health card is not available/no health card, ask mother/carer if exact date of birth is known

input.label: 's exact date of birth
input.hint: If child has a health card, get exact date of birth from health card. If no health card but mother/carer knows exact date of birth, record exact date of birth reported by mother/carer

input.label: Age of child (in months)
input.hint: Enter age in months (6-59 months) reported by mother/carer

input.label: Please get 's anthropometric measurements and record. Enter 0 for refusal to be measured.

select1.label: Has been measured like this in the past month?
Is there bilateral pitting oedema?
Has been measured like this in the past month?

input.label: Weight of child (kg)
input.hint: Enter weight in kilograms (kg) to the nearest 0.1 kg

select1.label: Has been measured like this in the past month?

input.label: Height of child (cm)
input.hint: Enter height in centimetres (cm) to the nearest 0.1 cm

select1.label: Has been measured like this in the past month?
Was measured lying down or standing up?
select1.hint: Children under 2 years of age should be measured lying down. Children 2 and older should be measured standing up.

select1.label: Was wearing clothes when measured?
Please confirm with team leader/supervisor. Does the child have bilateral pitting oedema?

item.label: Child not able to be examined

select1.hint: Ask mother / carer if child is in OTP or if child is taking "peanut butter". Show picture/sample of RUTF.

group.label: Questionnaire for the carers of children (SAM cases) who are NOT in the programme

input.label: is a SAM case not in the programme. Ask the following questions of the mother regarding 's condition and why is not in the programme.

select1.label: Do you think is sick?

select.label: What condition is your suffering from?

select1.label: Do you think is too thin or too small or too sick compared to other children?
select1.hint: Use case finding terms describing malnutrition / not growing well / not good weight / swollen feet

select1.label: Do you know / are you aware of treatment provided for for very thin, very small or very sick children like at the health centre?
select1.hint: Use case finding terms describing malnutrition / not growing well / not good weight / swollen feet

select.label: Why is not receiving this treatment for children who are very thin, very small or very sick?
select.hint: Use case finding terms describing malnutrition / not growing well / not good weight / swollen feet; Do not prompt. Probe with "Any other reasons?"

item.label: Mother / carer went to the health centre but the child was not measured
Mother / carer cannot carry more than one child
Mother / carer feels ashamed or shy about coming
There is no one else to take care of the other siblings
The child has been rejected by the programme already
Other parent's children have been rejected
Thought it was necessary to be enrolled at the hospital first
Does not think the programme can help child/children (prefer traditional healer, other treatment)
Heard that children who took treatment/ration/products got diarrhoea
Lack of money to pay for transport

select1.label: Was previously treated for [see hint] at the health centre?
select1.hint: Use case finding terms describing malnutrition / not growing well / not good weight / swollen feet

select.label: Why is not receiving treatment now?
select.hint: Do not prompt. Probe with "Any other reasons?"

item.label: Condition improved and discharged by the programme
Discharged because child was not recovering

input.label: Proceed to next child in household
The following questions are to be asked of only.

input.label: There are no children age 6-59 months in this household. Move to next household.

Mother has not consented to participating in the survey.
Thank mother for her time and move to next household.
If all children age 6-59 months in household have been assessed, **thank mother / carer** and **move to next household**
